I suddenly knew the secret of everything -- that we're all one, the universe is one. And that everything is beautiful.

question: Well you see Pam there's this crazy girl in here, she's just lying on the bed with her legs open and I don't know what to do.
answer: FUCK YOU!!! I want to see her.

question: It's your cousin Lizzie, you don't want to see her. Go home.
answer: We're all sisters, let me see her. Jim,... I got this wonderful leg of lamb in the oven for supper... and the house is immaculate. Sage is waiting. He wants you to play with him... are you coming...

question: Almost.
answer: Jim goddamit answer me!! JIM! I FUCKED HIM TO HURT YOU! HE DOESN'T MEAN ANYTHING TO ME!!

question: What was that promise you made Why don't you tell me what she said What was that promise that she made I'm gonna love you Till the heaven stops the rain I'm gonna love you Till the stars fall from the sky For you and I...
answer: ...fuckin' neanderthal primadonna is too drunk to see. Cut it... that was beautiful sweetheat, we had a technical problem, we'll take it again from the top babe whenever you're ready.

question: Paul babe.
answer: Right here baby.

question: Why don't you suck a fart out of my asshole you slave driving facist motherfucker!
answer: I hear the booze, I hear the smokes Jim, I don't hear the voice and babe I didn't hear the song!

question: What?... are you saying? Are we the Doors? One for all and all for one? Do you know what you're saying to those millions of kids! "Just kidding, not real". That's what you're saying.
answer: Oh come on man, you think just cause you're the lead man in the band you can run the whole show.

question: You think I was kidding Ray? Hey John, those are interesting shoes, you like those shoes?
answer: Yeah I do.

question: Good. Then do you want 50 of those shoes?
answer: No.

question: There sure is. In your fucking face! Just kidding... Hi Pam. Just watchin' some TV.
answer: I wanted you to find us Jim. It meant nothing.

question: I know. I know.
answer: You don't have to torture me Jim. Let me make it up to you, please...

question: It's alright honey, it's gonna be alright. You're my girl and that's the way it's always gonna stay.
answer: Really...?

question: Listen to 'em! They're not coming for the music anymore. They're coming to see a fuckin' freak show!
answer: You think it's easy for him. He moves left he's got vice squad, on the right narcs -- and the audience just waiting for him to get busted.

question: He wanted it! Not us. I just don't fuckin' get the point anymore. I never did I guess. Y'ask me he's just become a drunken fuckin' asshole that's what. And he's gonna take us down with him.
answer: Compassion was never your forte man.

question: C'mon Paul, you can get us some heroin man.
answer: No I can't and I won't.

question: Why not?
answer: Cause I don't want to participate in anything that would accomplish your goal?

question: Oh and what is my goal Paul? Death?
answer: "Death old friend".

question: ...if you live long enough, don't kid yourself Jimbo -- you're all alone out there, Jimbo, cept for me, cause you're too wacked out man, they're scared, you're too fuckin crazy.
answer: I wasn't mad, Tom. I was only interested in freedom.

question: Bullshit! You're bored, you're not free. You tested all the limits, fame, fucking, money, -- whatcha gonna do now Jimbo! When the music's over, when you're too fat and ugly to get on a stage, whatcha gonna do for act three -- puke on Heaven's door?
answer: Listen you two bit fuckin actor, you underestimate the audience. You think they all want a better job, a house, two cars, money, that's what you think but you know what they really want, Tom, in their lives, what they really want --

question: Tell me.
answer: ...something sacred, that's what they want, something sacred. Fuck you ignorant devil's asshole slave!

question: No you. Something sacred. My cock is sacred. Suck on that!
answer: I don't eat shrimp.

question: ...just a touch Robbie, it's the funkiest stuff, you'll play like an orgasm tonight...
answer: No man come on, I don't want any.

question: ...just a little lick, come on trust me... for old times, the four of us, let's get together one more time,... the Doors man... Please. For me.
answer: You said you love pain man, but you run from it every chance you get.

question: ARE YOU READY!!!! ARE YOU REAAAAAAADYYYYYYYYY!! YAAAAAOOOOOOOOOOWWWWWW... Love my girl! Five to one One in five No one here gets out alive You gets your baby I'll get mine Gonna make it, baby If we try
answer: The old get old The young get stronger May take a week And it may take longer They got the guns But we got the numbers Gonna win yeah -- WE'RE TAKING OVER!!

question: YAAAAAAOOOOOOWWWWWWW!!!
answer: Your ballroom days are over baby Night is drawing near Shadows of the evening Crawl across the years You walk across the floor With a flower in your hand Tryin to tell me no one understands Trade in your hours for a handful of dimes Gonna make it baby -- in our prime Get together one more time Get together

question: Yeah, STOP THE WAR MAN, PEACEEE...
answer: NO I'm not talkin' 'bout NO REVOLUTION. I'm not talkin 'bout no DEMONSTRATION. I'm talking 'bout HAVING SOME FUN. I'm talkin' 'bout DANCIN. I'm talkin 'bout LOVE. I'm talkin' 'bout some LOVE. LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE... LOVE!!!! Grab your friend -- and LOVE him. Come oooooaaaannnnn. Yeah!

question: "Light My Fire"! Come on Jim -- play "Light My Fire"!
answer: Ain't nobody gonna love my ass? Come on... I need ya. There's so many of ya out there and nobody's gonna love me! C'mon -- what'cha come here for anyway? You didn't come here for music. You didn't come here to see a good band. You came here for THIS didn't ya... I'm lonely out here -- Ya wanna SEE IT... COME ON SWEETHEART... I need it, I NEED IT, need ya, need ya, NEED YA, COME OOOOOAAAANNNNNNN... Didja see it! You wanna see it AGAIN???

question: Take it off! Take it all off!
answer: What if I pull it out fer ya!! And SHAKE IT AROUND!!! Will that do it for you! Would ya, would ya, would ya!! Now watch -- I'm gonna show it to ya! There it was! Ya see it? Ya see it?... Ya wanna see it again? COME ON UP HERE AND LOVE MY ASS! I WANNA SEE SOME ACTION OUT THERE! I WANNA SEE SOME ACTION OUT THERE! I WANNA SEE SOME ACTION OUT THERE! I WANNA SEE SOME ACTION OUT THERE! I WANT YOU TO LOVE MY ASS! I WANT SOME LOVE... LOVE... LOVE... LOVE C'MON, C'MON... NO LIMITS, NO LAWS YOU WANNA FUCK? COME ON! COME ON UP HERE!!!!! C'MON! C'MON! NO LIMITS, NO LAWS! NO LIMITS, NO LAWS! NO LIMITS, NO LAWS! I can't believe this is happening I can't believe all these people are sniffing each other & backing away, teeth grinning, hair raised, growling, here in the slaughtered wind This is it No more fun the death of all joy has come

question: ...Well, you gonna get rid of it? Fucked up people y'know, crazies, unwanted Indians just throw it in the river.
answer: I can't fucking believe you just said that!

question: Patricia, wouldn't it be better to have a kid with someone who wanted to be its father?
answer: It'd be a fucking genius, that's what it'd be! You and me. The child would be a god, goddess!

question: It'd be a monster. I got this trial dragging on me, Patricia. I couldn't support the kid -- I can't afford it and I don't want the responsibility right now.
answer: You're a COWARD!! A LITTLE BOY!! The only way you can't afford it is emotionally. You forgot your vows man. They were forever in the goddess' sight. Death doesn't part, only love Jim!

question: Come on Patricia, I was stoned... it seemed like the fun thing at the time.
answer: I'm gonna cut your balls off Morrison!

question: You want 'em?
answer: FUCK YOU. I'm gonna have the kid.

question: Then it'll be your kid. If you want the abortion I'll pay for it and I'll come up to New York to be with you when you have it.
answer: No you won't.

question: Yes I will.
answer: Bullshit Morrison You know who you are... NO. What difference does it make. You know, you never pretended. I did. I don't even like kids particularly, but I don't want the other thing either. I guess what I really want is to throw myself off this fucking balcony Well now that you've fucked the future, Morrison, have you fucked everything?... Have you looked at yourself in the mirror. Your stomach...

question: Please don't say those things to me, Patricia.
answer: Fuck me one last time, you worthless piece of shit.

question: Come on baby, come on.
answer: Jim we gotta finish "LA Woman".

question: Don't have an ending Ray.
answer: They're both gonna die... ARE YOU HAPPY YOU COCKSUCKERS!!

question: Come on baby, come on
answer: "...but one, the most beautiful one of all -- dances in a ring of fire -- "

question: "I see your hair is burning. If they say I never loved you, you know they are a liar!"
answer: "...and throws off the challenge with a shrug"

question: All the poetry has wolves in it Pam!!!
answer: I don't wanna die with you Jim Morrison, I don't wanna die!

question: C'mon Pam, this is it! We'll do it right here! Right now! You and me!
answer: Jim -- let's go, let's leave this town! You and me! Never come back.

question: We can. Right now. Just one more step...
answer: No Jim. I want to LIVE with you. I want to LIVE with you.

question: You know I've never been happier. Not as much of a rush as I used to be in y'know... this is the strangest life I've ever known.
answer: Gotta plane to catch man?

question: O?... splittling headache from which the future is made.
answer: Is Pam really there in Paris waiting?

question: Sure. The Count's there so where else would she be? Gotta try to start over, without all the hassles, y'know. I think we can.
answer: I never knew what you saw in that nightmare chick man.

question: Well she is kinda flakey -- like me. I mean she's just so vulnerable about everything. It makes me sad man. But she's always kinda believed in something about me y'know -- her little picture of me as the unsung poet -- and it's a fantasy I kinda dig y'know, 'stead of the one I live.
answer: I don't know man, I don't wanna sound like your old man but you're only 27, you're living like you gotta get it all in, you gotta slow down man, you did it, you broke thru to the other side.

question: We didn't break thru Ray, we just pushed things a little. When you really break thru, there's nothing left. No music, no Doors, no God, nothing -- only a will to power.
answer: I don't believe that. You were an American prince, man -- with overbred genes -- No! What could've been Jim? You could've been President. No man! What could've been Jim? We stood here on this beach on the edge of the Pacific that crazy summer day in '65 -- and we knew, you and I, we knew we were at the edge of the mind. we were there, man. One planet, one globe, one mind. Consciousness, we raised it, we were there.

question: And now what?
answer: Now? You've made me into Ishmael. I am the last survivor of the Pequod. And I exist only to tell the story of Ahab who fought the black whale.

question: It was white Ray. You gotta stop harpin' on that day. I was so ripped I can hardly remember it.
answer: Hey, what was that poem you once wrote about two chicks on the pier?

question: Come on man, I gotta fly.
answer: Come on. Just once.
